text.p: Westmin Resources Ltd stock fell while shares in Gibraltar Mines Ltd rose on news Gibraltar agreed to be acquired by Westmin in a C$307 million deal.
Westmin was off 1.25 at 6.25 in Toronto after falling to 6.10. It will finance the C$8.85 a share deal with cash and stock. Gibraltar gained 1.15 to 7.45 after peaking at 8.05.
Placer Dome Inc said it would tender its 30.8 percent stake in Gibraltar to the offer and reap a US$11 million net gain. Placer's stock dipped 0.15 to 31.85.

Placer, a big gold producer, provided the catalyst for the deal with its announcement last week that it was seeking seek a buyer for its stake in Gibraltar because it was not a core asset. Gibraltar operates a copper mine in British Columbia and is seeking financing to develop the Lomas Bayas copper project in Chile.

Westmin, a base metal miner, has previously said it was seeking acquisitions with a goal of having three to five major mines. It too has in the past been rumored to be a potential takeover target. Last year Brascan Ltd's Brascade Resources sold its 76 percent stake in Westmin.
